_comment_prompts: Customize output format in prompts/system_prompt.md. Output structure is now defined in the system prompt, not in config

filter_pass._comment: batch_size: number of bills per API call; timeout: seconds to wait for batch processing

analysis_pass._comment: timeout: seconds per bill analysis; api_delay: seconds to wait between LegiScan API calls (0 for no delay)

legiscan._comment: cache_enabled: cache LegiScan API responses; cache_directory: path to cache directory

_legacy_config_below: The configuration below is from the old plugin-based architecture and may not be used by current scripts

config.query: SELECT bill_id, bill_number, title, description, status, state_id, session_id, url, status_date, change_hash FROM ls_bill ORDER BY status_date DESC LIMIT 100

_comments._query_examples: Different query patterns for various use cases
_comments._filtered_by_year: SELECT * FROM ls_bill WHERE session_id IN (SELECT session_id FROM ls_session WHERE year_start >= %s)
_comments._filtered_by_status: SELECT * FROM ls_bill WHERE status = %s ORDER BY status_date DESC
_comments._recent_bills: SELECT * FROM ls_bill WHERE status_date >= DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 30 DAY)
_comments._custom_fields: SELECT bill_id, title, description, status FROM ls_bill WHERE state_id = %s
_docker_notes: If using Docker with host network mode, use localhost:3306
If using bridge network with port mapping (e.g., 3307:3306), use localhost:3307
If running this script in Docker network with database, use container name as host
_field_notes: Common ls_bill fields: bill_id, bill_number, title, description, status, state_id, session_id
Additional fields: url, status_date, change_hash, created, updated
Select only fields you need to reduce API token usage
